body_html:
@MalcolmSun

  • 0.12.head implies compiled from source, just FYI
  • As @vrv pointed out, we have some tools to help with the upgrade but we also list out the breaking changes in RELEASE.md. Note that there is a bit of churn these days as we work towards 1.0. Once 1.0 is out, as per semver (our versioning policy) things will be much more stable
  • You can use pip support to install specific versions (e.g. pip install "tensorflow==0.12.0")
body_text:
@MalcolmSun

0.12.head implies compiled from source, just FYI
As @vrv pointed out, we have some tools to help with the upgrade but we also list out the breaking changes in RELEASE.md. Note that there is a bit of churn these days as we work towards 1.0. Once 1.0 is out, as per semver (our versioning policy) things will be much more stable
You can use pip support to install specific versions (e.g. pip install "tensorflow==0.12.0")
body:
@MalcolmSun 

- 0.12.head implies compiled from source, just FYI
- As @vrv pointed out, we have some tools to help with the upgrade but we also list out the breaking changes in [RELEASE.md](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/RELEASE.md). Note that there is a bit of churn these days as we work towards 1.0. Once 1.0 is out, as per [semver](https://www.semver.org) (our [versioning policy](https://www.tensorflow.org/resources/versions)) things will be much more stable
- You can use `pip` support to install specific versions (e.g. `pip install "tensorflow==0.12.0"`)
